some people seem way hyperfocused on caleb's selfishness
and therefore ignore his character growth
which we saw just recently in this episode!
when he reached out to Beau and told her he liked her
summary: From the way Liam has phrased some things on social media, I’m actually starting to get a little hopeful about the fact that...
body:
From the way Liam has phrased some things on social media, I’m actually starting to get a little hopeful about the fact that Caleb might surprise some people with how much he cares about Nott in the upcoming episodes.

Caleb as a character has a huge soft spot for mothers and parental figures, and I think for as anxious and upset as he is, he’s not going to be particularly hurt by Nott lashing out (after all, he’s thought worse things about himself) and might, contrary to expectations, go into full-on Iron Shepherds Arc “Get Shit Done” mode.

He’s also a character whose main goal is to “fix” the biggest mistakes of his past, and if his past is also hurting his greatest friend…I could see him just wrapping up her goals with his as well. No matter how scared he is.

I’m not actually convinced this is what will happen, but I didn’t even consider the possibility before today, and now I’m not willing to fully discount it.

reblog.comment:

He’s also a character whose main goal is to “fix” the biggest mistakes of his past, and if his past is also hurting his greatest friend…I could see him just wrapping up her goals with his as well. No matter how scared he is.

I’m not actually convinced this is what will happen, but I didn’t even consider the possibility before today, and now I’m not willing to fully discount it.
trail.content:
From the way Liam has phrased some things on social media, I’m actually starting to get a little hopeful about the fact that Caleb might surprise some people with how much he cares about Nott in the upcoming episodes.

Caleb as a character has a huge soft spot for mothers and parental figures, and I think for as anxious and upset as he is, he’s not going to be particularly hurt by Nott lashing out (after all, he’s thought worse things about himself) and might, contrary to expectations, go into full-on Iron Shepherds Arc “Get Shit Done” mode.

He’s also a character whose main goal is to “fix” the biggest mistakes of his past, and if his past is also hurting his greatest friend…I could see him just wrapping up her goals with his as well. No matter how scared he is.

I’m not actually convinced this is what will happen, but I didn’t even consider the possibility before today, and now I’m not willing to fully discount it.

summary: im super late to the game but the way avantika was killed was fucking brutal and the way the group handled it kinda threw me...
body: im super late to the game but the way avantika was killed was fucking brutal and the way the group handled it kinda threw me like there was no remorse or at least empathy at all???? yes she forced them to do her bidding but they killed her people (yes they attacked them first but they’d done the same if a bunch of cloaked figures suddenly tried to grab one of them) before they even met, and fjord manipulated her a lot, to the point where he was sleeping with her while they stole the book they later used to get her killed, and he just brushes it off????

summary: Random D&D question. Does the spell Sending send a message to the physical body of someone or the psyche/soul? So like......
body: Random D&D question. Does the spell Sending send a message to the physical body of someone or the psyche/soul? So like… theoretically would someone using Sending to Nonagon have sent something to Molly? Or would it just never get heard?

summary:
Caleb:"Just one More Day. Will you regret it?"
..
Nott:"I'm so sorry. I'm so sorry I wasn't there to protect you."
Some pretty...
body:
Caleb:“Just one More Day. Will you regret it?”

..

Nott:“I’m so sorry. I’m so sorry I wasn’t there to protect you.”

Some pretty eerie and unexpected foreshadowing from Caleb’s words. Still reeling from the episode.

reblog.comment:
